chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael V Revzin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  
**05-13-16/Order vacating DNA surcharge on count six.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for
 404 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain fulltime employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Vocational/educational training.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No unsupervised contact with children under 18 years old.
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment. Random urine screens. Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: **10-02-15/Rest. Hearing, court ordered restitution in the amount of $5,760.00 payable to Alexander M. to be collected by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. To be paid during the period of entire sentence. Failure to pay by the end of sentence will result in a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael V Revzin in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Michael V Revzin in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Alexander M. and Shlomo L.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 33 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 404 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 13 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
AS TO COUNT 6:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEARS.  

As to each count: Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No alcohol or drugs.
*Absolute sobriety
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*No unsupervised contact with children under 18 years old
*Pay all costs and surcharges

As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay PLUS DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.  
 
Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 10.;

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

On motion of defense, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 2-20-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 6 OF AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Fourth Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, 4 AND 5:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 granted by the court.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 01/02/15. AR

$10,000 of bail to be returned to the surety.
$20,000 to be forfeited.

Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeded.  Arguments to the Court.
Court will return a portion of the bail.  The rest to remain forfeited.
Court orders that $10,000 bail to be returned to the surety.  $20,000 to remain forfeited.
